item.title: Mission Statement
item.dc:creator: thedavil
item.content:encoded:
Here at DX4D we are focused on providing quality assets to the Game Development community.
The assets available here are designed from the ground up to be modular and extendable. The primary goal is to build upon our previous work to create a component based game framework that can be extended and implemented by other developers. If you need help or have questions about any of the products available on this site, please use our official discord channel for the quickest response. As an alternative, there is an email button at the bottom of the page.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Contact
item.dc:creator: thedavil
item.content:encoded: This is a page with some basic contact information, such as an address and phone number. You might also try a plugin to add a contact form.

item.title: A homepage section
item.dc:creator: thedavil
item.content:encoded: This is an example of a homepage section. Homepage sections can be any page other than the homepage itself, including the page that shows your latest blog posts.

item.title: DX4D BASE LIBRARY
item.dc:creator: thedavil
item.content:encoded: A collection of DLL libraries that provide base functionality for the addons available on this site.
item.excerpt:encoded: A collection of DLL Libraries required by most of the addons available on this site.

item.title: Character View
item.dc:creator: thedavil
item.content:encoded:
Shows a view of any character in your game on the screen.
  • Total Customization (no coding required)
  • Drag and Drop installation
  • Animated Views
  • uMMORPG compatible with No Core Changes
  • UMA compatible (ummorpg requires a 3rd party addon to use UMA)
This is a Unity plugin specifically tailored to work with uMMORPG and UMA (neither is required). Originally it was designed to show a view of the player on the equipment screen that reflected changes to equipment in real-time. From there the plugin was extended to support various configurable views that can be used as a basis to develop a wide variety of plugins that require a view of the character. A few examples would be a character select screen, character creation screen, npc dialogue screens, a barber shop/tattoo shop, or even a minimap. It could even be used to make a plugin for trying on equipment or to show pieces of armor or other equipment in the shop. Bottom line is: It's versatile, and we're hoping to see a lot of good plugins developed using this plugin as a basis. CHANGELOG v1.102.1 -plugin released
item.excerpt:encoded: Shows a view of any character in your game on the screen. Designed for uMMORPG and supports UMA

item.title: Dialogue View
item.dc:creator: thedavil
item.content:encoded:
Shows a conversation on the screen between any 2 characters in your game. A necessary plugin for story-driven games.
  • Total Customization (no coding required)
  • Drag and Drop installation
  • Animated Views
  • uMMORPG compatible with No Core Changes
  • UMA compatible (ummorpg requires a 3rd party addon to use UMA)
This is a Unity plugin to show dialogue between characters in your game. It works with uMMORPG and UMA (neither is required). This plugin is built on top of the Character View plugin...if you purchased that plugin already you can get a discount on this one. CHANGELOG v1.102.1 -plugin released
item.excerpt:encoded: Shows a conversation on the screen between any 2 characters in your game. A necessary plugin for story-driven games. Designed for uMMORPG and supports UMA
